messages.content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nI used the "google" command and received information on recent developments and future trends in OLED technology. The search results included information on the increasing usage of foldable and rollable OLEDs in the generation of new mobile devices, as well as the projected growth of the global OLED market. Experts predict that OLED displays will become commonplace in TVs after conquering the smartphone and tablet scene. Additionally, the search results provided information on the current and future use of OLED technology, including its power efficiency and brighter pictures.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "oled_trends.txt", "text": "Recent developments and future trends in OLED technology:\\n- Forbes: TV Tech In 2022: Better OLEDs, Better LCDs, And A Little ... - Forbes\\n- GlobeNewswire: Worldwide OLED Industry to 2026 - Increasing Usage in Foldable and Rollable OLEDs in Generation of New Mobile Devices Presents Opportunities\\n- What Hi-Fi?: If OLED has reached its peak, what\'s the future of TV?\\n- OLEDWorks: OLED Light Trends, Strengths, and Opportunities - OLEDWorks\\n- TechPatio: 5 display technologies of the future - TechPatio\\n- GlobeNewswire: Global OLED Panel Market to 2030: Increasing Adoption of OLEDs in Smartphones Drives Growth\\n- Cmple.com: The Future of OLED Technology - Cmple.com\\n- IJERT: OLED Technology Research Progress and Prospects for Future Application"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.'}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "read_file", "args": {"filename": "oled_challenges.txt"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command read_file returned: OLED screens have faced several challenges, including limited lifespan, high production costs, and the need for improved efficiency. OLED screens are also susceptible to burn-in, which can cause permanent damage to the display. However, OLED technology has also presented several opportunities, including the ability to create flexible and transparent displays, as well as the potential for use in automotive lighting and medical devices. OLED technology is still evolving, and research is ongoing to address these challenges and further improve the technology.\n\nThe history of OLED screens dates back to the 1960s, when researchers first discovered the phenomenon of electroluminescence in organic materials. However, it was not until the 1980s that the first practical OLED devices were developed. These early devices were monochromatic and had limited efficiency and lifespan. Over the years, OLED technology has continued to evolve, with the development of full-color displays, improved efficiency, and longer lifespans. Today, OLED screens are used in a wide range of applications, including smartphones, televisions, and wearable devices.Challenges and opportunities of OLED screens:\n\n- Limited lifespan compared to other display technologies.\n- High cost of production, which limits their use in some applications.\n- Susceptibility to water damage, which limits their use in outdoor applications.\n- Potential for burn-in, which can cause permanent damage to the screen.\n- Opportunities for use in flexible and transparent displays, automotive lighting, and medical devices.'}]
"""
